aima.core.logic.propositional.algorithms
Class PLResolution

java.lang.Object
  aima.core.logic.propositional.algorithms.PLResolution

public class PLResolution
extends java.lang.Object

Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 255.

 
 function PL-RESOLUTION(KB, α) returns true or false
    inputs: KB, the knowledge base, a sentence in propositional logic
            α, the query, a sentence in propositional logic
            
    clauses ← the set of clauses in the CNF representation of KB ∧ ¬α
    new ← {}
    loop do
       for each pair of clauses Ci, Cj in clauses do
          resolvents ← PL-RESOLVE(Ci, Cj)
          if resolvents contains the empty clause then return true
          new ← new ∪ resolvents
       if new ⊆ clauses then return false
       clauses ← clauses ∪ new
Figure 7.12 A simple resolution algorithm for propositional logic. The function PL-RESOLVE returns the set of all possible clauses obtained by resolving its two inputs.

Author:
Ravi Mohan, Mike Stampone
